newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real closes flat in calm market.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real closes flat in calm market.

text.p: Brazil's real closed flat at 1.0810 per dollar in quiet trading in the commercial foreign exchange market despite continued volatility in the local stock exchanges, dealers said.

Strong dollar inflows helped keep the spot forex market calm. While preliminary figures for commercial and financial forex contracts showed a $12 million deficit at 1640 local/1940 GMT, dealers said they expected the day to end with a surplus.
Forex contracts for Thursday posted a $142.5 million surplus, and net capital flows so far this month showed a $1.99 billion surplus.
The dollar and interest rate futures closed calmer after volatile trading on Friday morning. August dollar contracts closed flat.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real rose 0.07 percent to close at 1.0865 per greenback due to dollar inflows, traders said.
In the parallel market, the real dropped 0.18 percent to end the day at 1.142 per dollar.
